pull.title: doc: CChainState return values
pull.body: It will always return true, unless a system error such as #15305 occurred

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#16743](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16743.html) (refactor: move LoadChainTip/RelayBlocks under CChainState by jamesob)
* [#16324](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16324.html) (Get cs_main out of the critical path in ProcessMessages by TheBlueMatt)
* [#16323](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/16323.html) (Call ProcessNewBlock() asynchronously by TheBlueMatt)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

events.message: doc: move-only ActivateBestChain doxygen comment to header

events.body: Added a commit that can be reviewed with the git diff options `--color-moved=dimmed-zebra --color-moved-ws=ignore-all-space`.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -211,7 +211,7 @@ static const uint64_t MIN_DISK_SPACE_FOR_BLOCK_FILES = 550 * 1024 * 1024;
  * @param[in]   pblock  The block we want to process.
  * @param[in]   fForceProcessing Process this block even if unrequested; used for non-network block sources and whitelisted peers.
  * @param[out]  fNewBlock A boolean which is set to indicate if the block was first received via this call
- * @return True if state.IsValid()
+ * @returns If the block was processed. (Might return true for invalid blocks or false for valid blocks)
comments.body: 2nd part is strange, maybe `@returns If the block was processed, independently of block validity`.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -211,7 +211,7 @@ static const uint64_t MIN_DISK_SPACE_FOR_BLOCK_FILES = 550 * 1024 * 1024;
  * @param[in]   pblock  The block we want to process.
  * @param[in]   fForceProcessing Process this block even if unrequested; used for non-network block sources and whitelisted peers.
  * @param[out]  fNewBlock A boolean which is set to indicate if the block was first received via this call
- * @return True if state.IsValid()
+ * @returns If the block was processed. (Might return true for invalid blocks or false for valid blocks)

@@ -2472,6 +2472,8 @@ void CChainState::PruneBlockIndexCandidates() {
 /**
  * Try to make some progress towards making pindexMostWork the active block.
  * pblock is either nullptr or a pointer to a CBlock corresponding to pindexMostWork.
+ *
+ * @returns true unless a system error occurred
  */
 bool CChainState::ActivateBestChainStep(CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, CBlockIndex* pindexMostWork, const std::shared_ptr<const CBlock>& pblock, bool& fInvalidFound, ConnectTrace& connectTrace)
comments.body: As the method is defined there, shouldn't this documentation be in the `.h` file? (same for `CChainState::ActivateBestChain` below)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -2472,6 +2472,8 @@ void CChainState::PruneBlockIndexCandidates() {
 /**
  * Try to make some progress towards making pindexMostWork the active block.
  * pblock is either nullptr or a pointer to a CBlock corresponding to pindexMostWork.
+ *
+ * @returns true unless a system error occurred
  */
 bool CChainState::ActivateBestChainStep(CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, CBlockIndex* pindexMostWork, const std::shared_ptr<const CBlock>& pblock, bool& fInvalidFound, ConnectTrace& connectTrace)
comments.body: `ActivateBestChainStep` is marked `private` and was never meant to be exposed in the header. I think it makes sense to keep the documentation close to the function implementation

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -2472,6 +2472,8 @@ void CChainState::PruneBlockIndexCandidates() {
 /**
  * Try to make some progress towards making pindexMostWork the active block.
  * pblock is either nullptr or a pointer to a CBlock corresponding to pindexMostWork.
+ *
+ * @returns true unless a system error occurred
  */
 bool CChainState::ActivateBestChainStep(CValidationState& state, const CChainParams& chainparams, CBlockIndex* pindexMostWork, const std::shared_ptr<const CBlock>& pblock, bool& fInvalidFound, ConnectTrace& connectTrace)
comments.body: Good point for the `public` method, though. So I fixed this for ABC only
